member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Hosting.QueryProcessor
member.summary: Class encapsulating query deserialization and operation execution, including result flattening and other processing. Basically this is the bridge between the service layer and the domain layer.

Traverse the result object graph, flattening into a single list. Note that this flattening must maintain relative ordering for the top level elements, since the client might have passed an order expression.
member.typeparam: The root entity Type of the query.
member.param: The list of entities to add to the results.
The root entities. The value can be null if the list of root results is already known.
The included entities.
Map used for the lifetime of the flattening to ensure that each entity is added to the results only once.
description for the DomainService.

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Hosting.QueryProcessor.RequiresFlattening(System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Server.DomainServiceDescription,System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether a query result of the given type requires flattening.
member.remarks:
This method exists to support a performance optimization to skip graph flattening of a query result when we discover the entity has no included associations. It takes inheritance into account by checking for included associations on the given type as well as all types derived from it.
This method evaluates only once per type and caches the result.
member.param: The to use to examine the entity hierarchy.
The entity type to analyze
member.returns: true if a query result of the given requires flattening.

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Hosting.QueryProcessor.GetEntityDerivedTypes(System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Server.DomainServiceDescription,System.Type)
member.summary: Returns the collection of all entity types derived from
member.param: The .
The entity type whose derived types are needed.
member.returns: The collection of derived types. It may be empty.

member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Hosting.DataContractSurrogateGenerator
member.summary: Takes care of generating CLR types based on the virtual shape of an entity type. E.g. we may be dealing with projection properties that don't physically exist on the CLR type. Because WCF doesn't know about TypeDescriptor, it won't see these virtual properties. This is why we generate CLR types that contain first-class properties. At serialization/deserialization time, the surrogate type will delegate to both the physical and virtual properties on the real entity object.

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Hosting.DataContractSurrogateGenerator.GetSurrogateType(System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{System.Type},System.Type)
member.summary: Emits a surrogate type for the specified type.
member.param: The known set of entity types.
The original type.
member.returns: The surrogate type.

member.summary: Default constructor.
member.param: A description of the this type creates surrogates for.
The map of known entity types to surrogate types. This object is passed in externally for efficiency reasons. Its contents won't change; the set is owned by this type.
The set of known surrogate types. This object is passed in externally for efficiency reasons. Its contents won't change; the set is owned by this type.
